events.name: Let's get this party started
events.description:
Welcome to the 1st edition of the Android Development Meetup!

We have to start somewhere, so let's begin with an informal gathering that will give us a chance to introduce ourselves, establish some group rules, and share some tech bits (so we don't just fall asleep).

The proposed agenda is:
- a very early preview of the next Trade Me app (material design / lollipop goodness)
- a couple of slots from other developers interested in showing off their work (will update this page once we have confirmation. Please get in touch with us if you're interested)
- open discussion about the future of this group
- quick chat about the Android Lobby group that we spoke about at DevMob
- lock in the next meet-up

To keep it nerdy, we'll provide beer and pizza...

Thanks,
The Android folk @ Trade Me

events.name: Transitions & Animations
events.description:
Hi all,

The majority has spoken: the main topic for the next meetup will be Transitions & Animations.

If you would like to present anything on this topic please get in touch. Otherwise, please start collating any examples of cool transitions and animations that you may have come across. This could be a good time to have another read of the Material Design guidelines.

We look forward to seeing you all again.

Cheers, Nick & Matt

p.s. we'll aim to provide food and drinks again. If you have any special dietary requirements please let us know.

events.name: Networking / Resource Loading
events.description:
Hi all,

We are happy to announce that Xero are hosting the 3rd installment of our meetup during business hours :)

According to our poll, the topic for this meetup is "Networking / Resource Loading". Please let us know if you are interested in presenting...

We look forward to seeing you all there! Nibbles will we provided.

Cheers,

Jie, Nick & Matt

events.name: Testing (Unit, Automated, Functional, etc)
events.description:
Hi all,

A bit short notice this time  (but you all knew it was coming, right?), but the topic should be quite accessible to most of you since it was runner up two times in a row.

Testing!

Let's focus our attention on testing, whether it's done by devs, testers, or business people. 

Please come and share your experience with:

• unit testing

• functional / integration testing

• automated testing

• button mashing

• user acceptance testing

• anything else you may have tried

The lovely folks at Powershop are hosting us this time. They are providing food and drinks too, so it will be a good one!

Please let us know if you'd like to give a short talk so we can have adapters and gadgetry ready.

See you all there!

Leandro, Jason & Nick
events.how_to_find_us: Not too far from Countdown in Newtown.

events.name: I/O Extended 2015
events.description:
The event is officially at capacity! Thanks for all the interest! If you haven't made it in yet, RSVP using this form: http://goo.gl/forms/9ec2vEWueA to join the waitlist and we'll email you if we can fit you!

Hi all,

The next meetup will be The I/O Extended 2015 - Wellington GDG event. (Try saying that 5 times fast).

Please visit this page to register.

Kate will host the evening and Matt will try to dial-in from San Francisco.

The agenda will be communicated closer to the day. We are seeking speakers for 5 to 10 minute long sessions!

We are currently seeking sponsors to help with printing T-shirts, providing food, and hopefully sorting out transportation for those who don't live in the CBD. Please get in touch if you wish to help.

Please come to room AM102 @ Vic University.

events.name: I/O Follow Up
events.description:
Hope you have all recovered from your I/O hangover by now and that you are ready to share what you've learned since. 

If you attended I/O Extended at Victoria University, then you don't want to miss this event because we have a small present for you :)

This being the first session post I/O we'll try and do more mingling and we'll also try to come up with the most meaningful sessions that derive from this year's announcements.

As always, bring your latest work with you if you'd like to share it with the group. If you started using any of the cool things that were mentioned in previous sessions, it would be great to hear how it's working out for you (RxJava, Realm anyone?)

See you all!

p.s. There will be free food and drinks provided by Trade Me...

events.name: Migrating to Material. Best practices
events.description:
Hi all,

It's time to get together again :)

Last time the Xero guys expressed interest in talking about their recent app release / facelift. Not only will they talk about it but they are hosting all of us to discuss about some best practices around rolling out Material Design! Thanks Xero!

See you all there!
events.how_to_find_us: Across the road from Amora Hotel

events.name: Application Architecture - MVC vs MVP vs MVVM vs ?
events.description:
Hi all,

It's time for the last Android Meetup of the year! The topic this time is Application Architecture. Here's a link to familiarize yourselves with some of the options out there. 

Many of you have been vocal about MVP. This is a good chance to make a case for it. Microsoft have been pushing hard for MVVM. Please consider telling the group about it if you are familiar with it. (We may have a speaker lined up).

Here are some questions we could ask ourselves:

• what are the benefits of one approach over the other(s)?

• would your choice of architecture change depending on app constraints (e.g. size, time to market, etc)?

• what does the app architecture choice enable (TDD, Design freedom, etc)?

• what approach is more friendly in the context of a large team?

• how would you transition an app from an approach to another (e.g. MVC to MVP)?

See you all soon!

events.name: Interactions outside the app (Push Notification, Now on Tap, Wearables etc)
events.description:
Topics so far. Please let us know if there is anything else you would like to see discussed during the meetup.

- AWS Mobile Hub

- Google Now: cards, redirect voice/typing search, on tap...

- Push notification musings (Carnival guys will speak)
events.how_to_find_us: We're the black building opposite the BP station on the corner of Taranaki and Wakefield Streets. We'll have people on the doors to show you the way. Please make sure you check in with a Xero member and tick your name off when you come in.

events.name: STUDENTS ONLY: Android Code Lab Weekend
events.description:
Come and learn to code for Android! 

Team forming and ideas on the Friday night, then spend the weekend hacking together a basic Android app! Industry mentors will be available during the weekend to help you with anything you need. 

Just like a regular hackathon it'll be happening all weekend. Stay as long as you can,  but you can pop in and out as you need to. 

The max hours we'll be running are roughly:

Friday 6pm-9pm

Saturday 9am-9pm

Sunday 9am-6pm

Open to students at Victoria University of Wellington with at least a little Java experience, and co-run with the VUW Google Student Ambassadors

events.name: Google I/O Keynote Breakfast Livestream
events.description:
Come hang out and enjoy the keynote on our comfy grandstand, in the company of other half-awake people!

The livestream starts at 5am, but Kate will be there to open the door and start the announcement bingo board a little earlier.

Breakfast will be provided :)
events.how_to_find_us: Head towards the Edward St entrance to capital market, and our door is there on the left

events.name: Mobile Refresh 2016
events.description:
Please visit http://mrw.gdg.nz for more information and  to register. Registration closes 28th June.

GDG Wellington, together with Cocoaheads Wellington is proud to bring you Mobile Refresh 2016. Our one-day conference is aimed at mobile technology enthusiasts who are interested in a quick update on the latest developments announced at Google I/O and WWDC.

Mobile Refresh will provide content for designers, developers, testers, or just about anyone passionate about mobile development. The vast majority of the sessions will be interactive. The conference takes a split approach: the morning is reserved for panel discussions and Q&A, while the afternoon is going to follow an un-conference format where the audience decides the discussion topics.

Attendees should expect discussions that cover both iOS and Android. The two platforms solve similar problems (albeit with different approaches), and it is our hope that at the end of the day everyone will have learned new things.

This event is made possible by these generous sponsors: Google, Trade Me, Victoria University, LilRegie, PaperKite, and Powershop. We need more sponsors, so please get in touch if you are interested in supporting our community.

Please visit http://mrw.gdg.nz for more information and  to register.

events.name: Authentication & Authorisation. Fingerprint scanning and more
events.description:
Hello everyone,

Let's all get together for an chat around Android security. There's a lot to cover: authentication, authorisation, app level vs API level security, obfuscation, fingerprint scanning, retina scans, and who knows what else.

We have one confirmed speaker, but would love to hear from anyone else who's keen to give a 5 to 10 minute talk (slides optional).

There'll be pizza and beer... 

See you all soon.

events.name: #MadeByGoogle Breakfast Livestream
events.description:
Come hang out and enjoy the keynote on our comfy grandstand, in the company of other half-awake people!

The livestream starts at 5am, but Kate will be there to open the door and set up food a little earlier.

Breakfast will be provided :)
events.how_to_find_us: Head towards the Edward St entrance to capital market, and our door is there on the left

events.name: DevFest 16 Wellington - Day 1

venue.name: Room AM102,Alan MacDiarmid building (next to Cotton Building)
venue.address_1: Victoria University Kelburn Campus, Kelburn Parade

events.description:
Welcome to GDG Wellington's very first DevFest!

This year we are tackling:

• Machine Learning (Day 1)

• Mobile Vision & Voice APIs (Day 1)

• Material Design (Day 2)

• TBD (Day 2)

Please register and feel free to get in touch via our Slack group if you have any questions.

Nick, Kate, Lucas are also ready to answer your questions.

We encourage you to bring a laptop and a mobile device with you on the day so that you can code along and get help from our mentors. We encourage you to follow our official Twitter account as we may make more announcements as the day nears closer.

Please note, if you are also interested in Day 2 of the event, you will need to register separately.

We are grateful to our sponsors: Victoria University and Google.

events.name: DevFest 16 Wellington - Day 2

venue.name: Room AM102,Alan MacDiarmid building (next to Cotton Building)
venue.address_1: Victoria University Kelburn Campus, Kelburn Parade

events.description:
Welcome to GDG Wellington's very first DevFest – Day 2!

This year we are tackling:

• Machine Learning (Day 1) - Nick Parfene

• Mobile Vision & Voice APIs (Day 1) - Chris Cooper

• Material Design (Day 2) - Duncan Forbes

• Angular 2 (Day 2) - Wilson Mendes

Please register and feel free to get in touch via our Slack group if you have any questions. 

Nick, Kate, Lucas are also ready to answer your questions.

We encourage you to bring a laptop and a mobile device with you on the day so that you can code along and get help from our mentors. We encourage you to follow our official Twitter account as we may make more announcements as the day nears closer.

Please note, if you are also interested in Day 1 of the event, you will need to register separately.

We are grateful to our sponsors: Victoria University and Google.

events.name: Coding for Android with Kotlin - let’s build a simple app in 90 minutes
events.description:
Happy New Year, everyone!

Kai Koenig has kindly accepted to put together a 90 minute Kotlin walkthrough for our group. At the end of this session we will have created a small Android app.

Check back a few days before the event as we will be providing a list of resources.

Bring a laptop with you if you'd like to code along. 

Trade Me will be providing food and drinks.

events.name: Joint session with Wellington-kt. Come code Kotlin
events.description:
Hi again,

At the first Kotlin meetup there was  interest in learning more about Kotlin and quite a few people thought it'd be nice to work through some Kotlin Koans together. 

Join us on the 4th of April for some coding fun. Bring your laptop with IntelliJ/Android Studio and the Koans project setup (https://kotlinlang.org/docs/tutorials/koans.html) and we'll see how far we get :-)

Bring your laptop with IntelliJ/Android Studio and the Koans project setup (https://kotlinlang.org/docs/tutorials/koans.html) and we'll see how far we get. If you don't have a laptop you can pair up with someone who does on the night.

Some setup suggestions:

1. Ideally, clone the Github repository before you come to the meetup. It also has recently been updated for Kotlin 1.1

2. Make sure you have IntelliJ or Android Studio in an up-to-date version with the Kotlin 1.1 plugin installed.

3. Alternatively you can also get Kotlin Koans through the Kotlin Educational Plugin: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0ponbfQhESY&feature=youtu.be - it looks like a nice and easy way to get everything setup.

On the night, we'll start with the Kotlin Koans, section (i) ("introduction") and work our way through the problems in there - totally suitable for Kotlin beginners or people with very little Kotlin experience.

Trade Me is providing pizza and drinks but the spaces are limited.

(Please RSVP even if you have already RSVPed to the Wellington-kt event).

Got questions? Jump in Slack http://slack.gdg.nz or message us on Twitter.

See you all soon and apologies for the short notice.

events.name: I/O Follow Up
events.description:
Hi everyone,

Hopefully you've had a chance to process the news from Google I/O. Let's get together and have an informal chat about:

• what caught your eye,

• how you think the news will impact the apps that you work on,

• new ideas and possibilities,

• how things were on the ground at I/O :-)

If you cannot make it to the meetup, you can still get in touch with the community via our Slack group.

See you soon and keep warm...

events.name: Mobile Refresh 2017
events.description:
GDG Wellington, together with Cocoaheads Wellington is proud to bring you Mobile Refresh 2017. Our one-day conference is aimed at mobile technology enthusiasts who are interested in exploring the possibilities brought by the latest announcements at Google I/O and WWDC.

Registration: https://mobile-refresh-2017.lilregie.com/ Early bird tickets cost $25 and are available until Sunday, August 6th. The full price of the event will be $45 and full price tickets are available until August 22nd. 

Important: You cannot register for the event via Meetup! Please use the link above.

Call for papers: Please consider answering our call for papers and share some of your knowledge with the other attendees.

Mobile Refresh will provide content for designers, developers, testers, or just about anyone passionate about mobile development. Many of the sessions will be interactive, but there is no expectation that everyone must contribute. 

We are privileged to welcome local and international speakers (including several Googlers from the Cloud team). Please check our website closer to the date for an updated agenda.

Attendees should expect discussions that cover iOS, Android, and the supporting tools and frameworks. The two platforms solve similar problems (albeit with different approaches), and it is our hope that at the end of the day everyone will have learned new things. 

Events such as this (e.g. I/O Extended and DevFest) are part of a global series of conferences. We are grateful to each and every one of you for your contribution to making this event better (and larger) every year!

This event is made possible by our generous sponsors. Thank you for your ongoing support!

We expect all people attending at our event to have read and accepted our Code of Conduct: http://bit.ly/GDGWLGCoC

For more information, please visit http://mrw.gdg.nz

events.name: #MadeByGoogle Breakfast Livestream 2017
events.description:
Come and get hyped for the latest Google announcements (Pixel 2 anyone?) with other half-awake people!

The livestream starts at 5am, but Kate will be there to open the door and set up a little earlier.

Breakfast will be provided, and there's a coffee machine available for those who know how to use it :)

If you can't find the venue on the day tweet @Mistyepd on twitter or comment in this event on Meetup

As for all of our events, our Code of Conduct applies https://github.com/GDGWellington/GDGWellingtonCodeOfConduct
events.how_to_find_us: Head towards the Edward St entrance to capital market, and our blue door is there on the left

events.name: Codelab: Let's learn about Android Instant Apps
events.description:
Android Instant Apps are a cool new feature that enables native Android applications to run in response to launching a URL without requiring installation.

In this codelab we'll spend ~1 hr to take an existing Android app and add Instant App functionality to it as well as allow it to be installed the usual way. Bring your laptop and join us in learning about Instant Apps and how to build them. BNZ will supply refreshments.

events.name: How do you architect your Android App?
events.description:
• What we'll do
Let's get together and chat about how the Android App Architecture has evolved and what your approach is today.

At I/O Google introduced the Architecture Components.
At DroidconNY, Ray Ryan described the Rx Workflow Pattern they use at Square.

What approach do you take? What approach would you take if we were to start over?

Presentations would be most welcome! If you can share, please get in touch with Nick via Slack http://slack.gdg.nz or https://twitter.com/@nicktmro

As always there will be Pizza & drinks.

References:
https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/index.html
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KjoMnsc2lPo

• Important to know
We expect all people attending our events to abide by our Code of Conduct. https://github.com/GDGWellington/GDGWellingtonCodeOfConduct

events.name: Google I/O Extended
events.description:
Welcome to the 2018 edition of Google I/O Extended!

We are super excited to present you with an jam packed agenda. If you can, bring a fully charged laptop as we may be getting our fingers dirty with some code. If you're not a developer, don't worry, there'll be plenty code-agnostic discussion topics!

Agenda:
- Google I/O Highlights Recap and Open Discussion
- A flutter of awesome talks
- Time permitting we will run through a Codelab
- Hangout* with San Jose
- Pizza and Drinks

What to bring:
- An open mind
- A charged laptop (if you plan to code along) with an up to date Android Studio or VS Code
- Your notes if you have already watched the keynote / other live streamed sessions

Many thanks to Flux Federation for powering our event!

We look forward to seeing you all!

*Kate will be at I/O and we will be trying to get her to share her impressions from California

events.name: Mobile Refresh 2018 - #DevFest18
events.description:
Mobile Refresh 2018 will be held on September 7, 2018 at Victoria University in Wellington.

Our event aims to bring together 200+ mobile technology enthusiasts. The conference attracts attendees who are interested in learning and debating about the latest developments and trends in mobile technologies.

Mobile Refresh Wellington will provide content for designers, developers, testers, or just about anyone passionate about mobile development. We want to encourage attendees to look beyond their day-to-day platform of choice and keep up to date with more general trends in mobile tech.

Buying a ticket means you chose to respect our Code of Conduct. Please check out www.mobilerefresh.nz for the details and to buy your ticket.

NOTE: You do not need to RSVP to this event, but you're more than welcome to if you wish to let other GDGers know that you'll be attending Mobile Refresh.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam (session 1)
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is already used by developers and organisations around the world, and is free and open source.

If you want to get started on building Flutter apps, join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course materials prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

This is the first of three sessions. The second session will be on October 18 and the third and final session will be on November 21.

Please bring bring a laptop! The course material will run on all of the latest versions of popular browsers and for the best experience, the laptop should already have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac should all be fine.

Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Study Jams are *not* traditional instructor-led, classroom-based trainings. Instead they're better described as "guided hackathons" in which everyone works together to understand and learn new things.

Thanks a lot to our friends at BizDojo Tory Street who let us use their events space for the Flutter Study Jam.

Rough agenda for session 1:

- Flutter Udacity Course Introduction
- Working through the first parts of the Udacity Course Lesson 1
- Playing with Flutter

[UPDATE]
** Please note that this event will have some limited amounts of catering. See comment below.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam (session 2)
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is already used by developers and organisations around the world, and is free and open source.

If you want to get started on building Flutter apps, join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course materials prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

This is the second of three sessions. The third and final session will be on November 21. Please be aware that if you've missed the first session, you'll need to set up a working Flutter version and get yourself up to speed with the Flutter course material up to Lession 1, Unit 20.

In this session we're continuing to work with Flutter and finish Lesson 1 and will cover the first parts of Lesson 2.

Study Jams are not traditional instructor-led, classroom-based trainings. Instead they're better described as "guided hackathons" in which everyone works together to understand and learn new things.

Thanks a lot to our friends at BizDojo Tory Street who let us use their events space for the Flutter Study Jam.

Rough agenda for session 2:

- Finishing Udacity Course Lesson 1
- Working through the first parts of the Udacity Course Lesson 2
- Playing with Flutter

events.name: Flutter Study Jam (session 3)
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is already used by developers and organisations around the world, and is free and open source.

If you want to get started on building Flutter apps, join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course materials prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

This is the third and final of three sessions. Please be aware that if you've missed either of the first or second session, it'd be really of advantage if you had a working Flutter installation and worked through the covered material of session 1 and/or 2 in your own time.

In this session we're continuing to work with Flutter and finish Lesson 2 and have a graduation ceremony for everyone who made it through the three sessions.

Study Jams are not traditional instructor-led, classroom-based trainings. Instead they're better described as "guided hackathons" in which everyone works together to understand and learn new things.

Thanks a lot to our friends at BizDojo Tory Street who let us use their events space for the Flutter Study Jam.

Rough agenda for session 3:

- Finishing Udacity Course Lesson 2
- "Graduation"
- Playing with Flutter

** Please note that this event doesn't have catering. If you or your employer is interested in sponsoring food and/or drinks for the Study Jam, please get in touch. Otherwise it's BYO or Uber Eats :-)

events.name: Making the most of 2019
events.description:
How is it February already?!

Let's get together and plan our events for this year (sponsors welcome!). We thought we'd get together over fish & chips and have a more informal session than the usual. Hopefully this will allow us to make the most of this excellent weather (fingers crossed I didn't just jinx it) and help us get to know each other better.

Topics for conversation:
- things you learned over the break
- new tools and resources you've come across that you really enjoyed
- new apps / libraries you published or you fell in love with (promote your own!)
- topics you think our GDG should tackle in 2019
- anything else you believe would be interesting to our group :)

SPONSOR WANTED: it would be amazing if you or one of your employers could sponsor at least part of this event. Whether it's paying for some bowls of chips, or for sparkling water, any help would be much appreciated since not all our members can afford lunch from a pub.

See you there!

Reminder: Our Code of Conduct applies regardless of the fact that we are not meeting at a venue provided by a sponsor.

events.name: Google I/O 2019 Extended
events.description:
We are excited to organise an #io19extended event this year!

Some of you may have attended the previous I/O Extended events so we will try and run it with a familiar agenda:
- Keynote summary
- Hangout with GDG members in Mountain View
- Impressions, discussions, ideas for how this can be put to use in our apps and services

Food and drinks will be provided 🍕

See you all very soon!
events.how_to_find_us: Come up to Level 5. Don't forget to sign in when you arrive.

events.name: Continuous Delivery for Mobile
events.description:
How can we make releasing mobile apps painless?

We all know how painful releasing can be. As your team grows, so does your output and often releasing can becomes a bottleneck. Resolving merge conflicts, smoke testing and hot fixing are not a developers favourite activities.

At Xero we’ve been experimenting with our release process and would like to share what we’ve learnt, where we’re looking to improve and to hear everyone else’s approach to releasing their mobile apps.

We'll be touching on the following tools/frameworks/technologies:
- Jenkins
- Google Play Developer API
- Octopus (release orchestration tool)
- Firebase Test Lab
events.how_to_find_us: This event will be held at Xero HQ which is on the corner of Taranaki St and Wakefield St. Head to level 3 and there will be someone in the foyer to let you in.

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Wellington
events.description:
Welcome to Kotlin/Everywhere Wellington!

Whether you’re a mobile developer learning Kotlin to build your first Android app, or you develop web applications and are looking for a modern, safe language to use in both your server-side code and the frontend, Kotlin/Everywhere got you covered.

Kotlin is a modern and statically typed programming language targeting the JVM, Android, JavaScript & Native that will boost your productivity and increase your developer happiness.

Come and see for yourself how fun learning and using Kotlin can really be!

Tickets are NZ$ 10 and registration is open at LilRegie now:

https://kotlin-extended-wellington.lilregie.com

Please note that you HAVE to register at the above URL and get a ticket for the event to be able to attend Kotlin/Everywhere Wellington!

Do not RSVP on this Meetup page, please.

We have a stellar lineup of speakers for Kotlin/Everywhere Wellington:

• Zarah Dominguez:
"All Juiced Up: Supercharging Your Android Debug Builds"

• Isaac Udy:
"Build your own Chimera - Getting started with Kotlin Multiplatform"

• Jamie Sanson:
"Handing over the reigns to Kotlin Delegates"

• Nic Tolentino:
".let{s} .also repeat() .run with() .apply - Understanding Kotlin scope and extension functions"

• Kierran McPherson: "Using Kotlin to deploy Kotlin - Looking at using Kotlin to define build pipelines in TeamCity"

Thanks to our sponsors who make this event possible.

If your organisation would like to support this event, too, please get in touch.

We will be updating this page with more detailed information about the venue as well as a more detailed agenda. In the meantime, we invite you to join our Slack for any questions you may have:

https://gdgnz.herokuapp.com/

As always, our Code of Conduct applies to this event: https://github.com/GDGWellington/GDGWellingtonCodeOfConduct

group_profile.intro: Building web and Android app stuff from NZ w. Kotlin, Java, CFML, JS, Go and others. Also fly small planes & play Nintendo 3DS (Friend code:[masked]) Find me on Twitter: @AgentK
Coffee lover, mobile enthusiast, father, and a good dog's best friend.
